channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Variable Imaging Projection Cloud Scattering Tomography
item.description: The paper is the first to demonstrate CT of a real cloud using empirical data directly in a DNN.

item.title: A Multi Camera Unsupervised Domain Adaptation Pipeline for Object Detection in Cultural Sites through Adversarial Learning and Self-Training
item.description: Object detection algorithms allow to enable many interesting applications which can be implemented in different devices, such as smartphones and wearable devices.

item.title: Rethinking Conversational Recommendations: Is Decision Tree All You Need?
item.description: Fourthly, when the user rejects a recommendation, we adaptively choose the next decision tree to improve subsequent questions and recommendations.

item.title: Stationary Kernels and Gaussian Processes on Lie Groups and their Homogeneous Spaces I: the Compact Case
item.description: The invariance of a Gaussian process' covariance to such symmetries gives rise to the most natural generalization of the concept of stationarity to such spaces.

item.title: LANIT: Language-Driven Image-to-Image Translation for Unlabeled Data
item.description: Existing techniques for image-to-image translation commonly have suffered from two critical problems: heavy reliance on per-sample domain annotation and/or inability of handling multiple attributes per image.

item.title: Cell-Free Latent Go-Explore
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Latent Go-Explore (LGE), a simple and general approach based on the Go-Explore paradigm for exploration in reinforcement learning (RL).

item.title: Audiogram Digitization Tool for Audiological Reports
item.description: A number of private and public insurers compensate workers whose hearing loss can be directly attributed to excessive exposure to noise in the workplace.

item.title: SIM-Trans: Structure Information Modeling Transformer for Fine-grained Visual Categorization
item.description: To address the above limitations, we propose the Structure Information Modeling Transformer (SIM-Trans) to incorporate object structure information into transformer for enhancing discriminative representation learning to contain both the appearance information and structure information.

item.title: Improving RGB-D Point Cloud Registration by Learning Multi-scale Local Linear Transformation
item.description: In addition to previous methods that seek correspondences by hand-crafted or learnt geometric features, recent point cloud registration methods have tried to apply RGB-D data to achieve more accurate correspondence.

item.title: Dual-Space NeRF: Learning Animatable Avatars and Scene Lighting in Separate Spaces
item.description: Previous methods alleviate the inconsistency of lighting by learning a per-frame embedding, but this operation does not generalize to unseen poses.

item.title: NestedFormer: Nested Modality-Aware Transformer for Brain Tumor Segmentation
item.description: Multi-modal MR imaging is routinely used in clinical practice to diagnose and investigate brain tumors by providing rich complementary information.

item.title: ARMA Cell: A Modular and Effective Approach for Neural Autoregressive Modeling
item.description: In this work, we introduce the ARMA cell, a simpler, modular, and effective approach for time series modeling in neural networks.

item.title: Style-Agnostic Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We present a novel method of learning style-agnostic representation using both style transfer and adversarial learning in the reinforcement learning framework.

item.title: Ant Colony Optimization for Mining Gradual Patterns
item.description: Gradual pattern extraction is a field in (KDD) Knowledge Discovery in Databases that maps correlations between attributes of a data set as gradual dependencies.

item.title: PyTorch Image Quality: Metrics for Image Quality Assessment
item.description: Image Quality Assessment (IQA) metrics are widely used to quantitatively estimate the extent of image degradation following some forming, restoring, transforming, or enhancing algorithms.

item.title: EViT: Privacy-Preserving Image Retrieval via Encrypted Vision Transformer in Cloud Computing
item.description: To this end, image-encryption-based privacy-preserving image retrieval schemes have been developed, which first extract features from cipher-images, and then build retrieval models based on these features.

item.title: One-class Recommendation Systems with the Hinge Pairwise Distance Loss and Orthogonal Representations
item.description: In one-class recommendation systems, the goal is to learn a model from a small set of interacted users and items and then identify the positively-related user-item pairs among a large number of pairs with unknown interactions.

item.title: 2BiVQA: Double Bi-LSTM based Video Quality Assessment of UGC Videos
item.description: Recently, with the growing popularity of mobile devices as well as video sharing platforms (e. g., YouTube, Facebook, TikTok, and Twitch), User-Generated Content (UGC) videos have become increasingly common and now account for a large portion of multimedia traffic on the internet.

item.title: A Fair Experimental Comparison of Neural Network Architectures for Latent Representations of Multi-Omics for Drug Response Prediction
item.description: One important parameter is the depth of integration: the point at which the latent representations are computed or merged, which can be either early, intermediate, or late.

item.title: Federated Online Clustering of Bandits
item.description: Contextual multi-armed bandit (MAB) is an important sequential decision-making problem in recommendation systems.

item.title: MODNet: Multi-offset Point Cloud Denoising Network Customized for Multi-scale Patches
item.description: Second, a multi-scale perception module is designed to embed multi-scale geometric information for each scale feature and regress multi-scale weights to guide a multi-offset denoising displacement.

item.title: FAST-AID Brain: Fast and Accurate Segmentation Tool using Artificial Intelligence Developed for Brain
item.description: A novel deep learning method is proposed for fast and accurate segmentation of the human brain into 132 regions.

item.title: Uncertainty-Induced Transferability Representation for Source-Free Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: Secondly, based on the UTR, we propose a novel Calibrated Adaption Framework (CAF) for SFUDA, including i)the source knowledge calibration module that guides the target model to learn the transferable source knowledge and discard the non-transferable one, and ii)the target semantics calibration module that calibrates the unreliable semantics.

item.title: CAIR: Fast and Lightweight Multi-Scale Color Attention Network for Instagram Filter Removal
item.description: We propose an accurate, fast, lightweight network with multi-scale and color attention for Instagram filter removal (CAIR).

item.title: Deep Autoencoders for Anomaly Detection in Textured Images using CW-SSIM
item.description: Detecting anomalous regions in images is a frequently encountered problem in industrial monitoring.

item.title: Prior-Aware Synthetic Data to the Rescue: Animal Pose Estimation with Very Limited Real Data
item.description: Here, we present a very data efficient strategy targeted for pose estimation in quadrupeds that requires only a small amount of real images from the target animal.

item.title: Do language models make human-like predictions about the coreferents of Italian anaphoric zero pronouns?
item.description: Some languages allow arguments to be omitted in certain contexts.

item.title: Nonparametric and Online Change Detection in Multivariate Datastreams using QuantTree
item.description: Like many change-detection algorithms, QT-EWMA builds a model of the data distribution, in our case a QuantTree histogram, from a stationary training set.

item.title: MapTR: Structured Modeling and Learning for Online Vectorized HD Map Construction
item.description: We adopt a hierarchical query embedding scheme to flexibly encode structured map information and perform hierarchical bipartite matching for map element learning.

item.title: FDB: Fraud Dataset Benchmark
item.description: We hope that FDB helps in the development of customized fraud detection techniques catered to different fraud modus operandi (MOs) as well as in the improvement of AutoML systems that can work well for all datasets in the benchmark.

item.title: Compound Figure Separation of Biomedical Images: Mining Large Datasets for Self-supervised Learning
item.description: In order to extract and separate compound figures into usable individual images for downstream learning, we propose a simple compound figure separation (SimCFS) framework without using the traditionally required detection bounding box annotations, with a new loss function and a hard case simulation.

item.title: Probing Contextual Diversity for Dense Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Detection of out-of-distribution (OoD) samples in the context of image classification has recently become an area of interest and active study, along with the topic of uncertainty estimation, to which it is closely related.

item.title: Boosting Night-time Scene Parsing with Learnable Frequency
item.description: Based on this, we propose to exploit the image frequency distributions for night-time scene parsing.

item.title: HiGNN: Hierarchical Informative Graph Neural Networks for Molecular Property Prediction Equipped with Feature-Wise Attention
item.description: Elucidating and accurately predicting the druggability and bioactivities of molecules plays a pivotal role in drug design and discovery and remains an open challenge.

item.title: You Only Search Once: On Lightweight Differentiable Architecture Search for Resource-Constrained Embedded Platforms
item.description: Benefiting from the search efficiency, differentiable neural architecture search (NAS) has evolved as the most dominant alternative to automatically design competitive deep neural networks (DNNs).

item.title: Synthehicle: Multi-Vehicle Multi-Camera Tracking in Virtual Cities
item.description: Smart City applications such as intelligent traffic routing or accident prevention rely on computer vision methods for exact vehicle localization and tracking.

item.title: Airway measurement by refinement of synthetic images improves mortality prediction in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
item.description: We compare our ATN model with a state-of-the-art GAN-based network (simGAN) using a) qualitative assessment; b) assessment of the ability of ATN and simGAN based CT airway metrics to predict mortality in a population of 113 patients with IPF.

item.title: LINKS: A dataset of a hundred million planar linkage mechanisms for data-driven kinematic design
item.description: LINKS is made up of various components including 100 million mechanisms, the simulation data for each mechanism, normalized paths generated by each mechanism, a curated set of paths, the code used to generate the data and simulate mechanisms, and a live web demo for interactive design of linkage mechanisms.

item.title: The case for fully Bayesian optimisation in small-sample trials
item.description: While sample efficiency is the main motive for use of Bayesian optimisation when black-box functions are expensive to evaluate, the standard approach based on type II maximum likelihood (ML-II) may fail and result in disappointing performance in small-sample trials.

item.title: Learning Representations for Hyper-Relational Knowledge Graphs
item.description: It motivates us to design a framework that utilizes multiple aggregators to learn representations for hyper-relational facts: one from the perspective of the base triple and the other one from the perspective of the qualifiers.

item.title: DLDNN: Deterministic Lateral Displacement Design Automation by Neural Networks
item.description: Moreover, this tool is generalizable to other field-based problems and since the neural network is an integral part of this method, it enables transfer learning for similar physics.

item.title: ANT: Exploiting Adaptive Numerical Data Type for Low-bit Deep Neural Network Quantization
item.description: In this work, we propose a fixed-length adaptive numerical data type called ANT to achieve low-bit quantization with tiny hardware overheads.

item.title: Effective Multi-User Delay-Constrained Scheduling with Deep Recurrent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Multi-user delay constrained scheduling is important in many real-world applications including wireless communication, live streaming, and cloud computing.

item.title: EchoGNN: Explainable Ejection Fraction Estimation with Graph Neural Networks
item.description: In this work, we introduce EchoGNN, a model based on graph neural networks (GNNs) to estimate EF from echo videos.

item.title: CUAHN-VIO: Content-and-Uncertainty-Aware Homography Network for Visual-Inertial Odometry
item.description: Learning-based visual ego-motion estimation is promising yet not ready for navigating agile mobile robots in the real world.

item.title: k-MS: A novel clustering algorithm based on morphological reconstruction
item.description: This work proposes a clusterization algorithm called k-Morphological Sets (k-MS), based on morphological reconstruction and heuristics.

item.title: Self-Supervised Pyramid Representation Learning for Multi-Label Visual Analysis and Beyond
item.description: In particular, we present a cross-scale patch-level correlation learning in SS-PRL, which allows the model to aggregate and associate information learned across patch scales.

item.title: MeloForm: Generating Melody with Musical Form based on Expert Systems and Neural Networks
item.description: Specifically, 1) we design an expert system to generate a melody by developing musical elements from motifs to phrases then to sections with repetitions and variations according to pre-given musical form; 2) considering the generated melody is lack of musical richness, we design a Transformer based refinement model to improve the melody without changing its musical form.

item.title: Video-based Cross-modal Auxiliary Network for Multimodal Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Multimodal sentiment analysis has a wide range of applications due to its information complementarity in multimodal interactions.

item.title: Controllable 3D Generative Adversarial Face Model via Disentangling Shape and Appearance
item.description: 3D face modeling has been an active area of research in computer vision and computer graphics, fueling applications ranging from facial expression transfer in virtual avatars to synthetic data generation.
